definition[0]: to talk for a long time in a way that does not seem clearly organized, so that other people find it difficult to understand you
example[0]: She’s getting old and she tends to ramble a bit.
definition[1]: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure
example[1]: There’s plenty to discover as you ramble around this little island.
definition[2]: a plant that rambles grows in all directions
definition[3]: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
example[2]: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
definition[4]: a speech or piece of writing that is very long and does not seem to be clearly organized
example[3]: In a ten-page ramble, Barre explains why he wrote the book.
